citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee was unable to find an APHIS Form 7006 for three pups that were sold sometime around June of 2023. Not
being able to find records doesn't allow for APHIS officials to be able properly track animals going through the licensee's
facility. The licensee must file or secure all records so they are available to be inspected by APHIS officials during the
inspection process. Correct starting on 9/27/23.

The licensee is treating a female Bichon/Poodle mix for a sore/scrape on its left front shoulder with Blu-Kote per the
Attending Veterinarian's orders, but the licensee has failed to document the injury to the dog or the Veterinarian's
diagnosis and treatment plan. Not documenting everything done to the dog medically doesn't allow for APHIS officials to
ensure the dog is being treated properly by the Attending Veterinarian. All injuries/illnesses to any dog must be
documented going forward. All diagnoses/prognoses and treatment plans must also be documented by the licensee as
required under the Animal Welfare Act. Correct starting on 9/27/23.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The licensee was unable to find an APHIS Form 7006 for three pups that were sold sometime around June of 2023. Not 
being able to find records doesn't allow for APHIS officials to be able properly track animals going through the licensee's 
facility. The licensee must file or secure all records so they are available to be inspected by APHIS officials during the 
inspection process. Correct starting on 9/27/23. 
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is treating a female Bichon/Poodle mix for a sore/scrape on its left front shoulder with Blu-Kote per the 
Attending Veterinarian's orders, but the licensee has failed to document the injury to the dog or the Veterinarian's 
diagnosis and treatment plan. Not documenting everything done to the dog medically doesn't allow for APHIS officials to 
ensure the dog is being treated properly by the Attending Veterinarian. All injuries/illnesses to any dog must be 
documented going forward. All diagnoses/prognoses and treatment plans must also be documented by the licensee as 
required under the Animal Welfare Act. Correct starting on 9/27/23. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.

n
